member.name: T:Json.More.EnumStringConverter`1
member.remarks:
This serializer supports the to indicate custom value naming.
The is supported via serializing to an array of base values. Inclusion of composite values is not supported.

member.name: M:Json.More.EnumStringConverter`1.Read(System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader@,System.Type,System.Text.Json.JsonSerializerOptions)
member.summary: Reads and converts the JSON to type .
member.param: An object that specifies serialization options to use.
member.exception: Element was not a string or could not identify the JSON value as a known enum value.

member.param: The value to convert to JSON.
An object that specifies serialization options to use.

member.name: T:Json.More.JsonDocumentEqualityComparer
member.remarks:
This comparison is compliant with the ideals expressed by JSON:
- Objects are unordered. - Arrays are ordered.

member.name: M:Json.More.JsonDocumentEqualityComparer.Equals(System.Text.Json.JsonDocument,System.Text.Json.JsonDocument)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified objects are equal.
member.param: The first object of type T to compare.
The second object of type T to compare.
member.returns: true if the specified objects are equal; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Returns a hash code for the specified object.

member.returns: A hash code for the specified object.
member.exception: The type of obj is a reference type and obj is null.

member.returns: true if the documents are equivalent; false otherwise.
